Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

params._courtID: The ID of the policy's court.
params._courtName: The name of the policy's court.
params._policy: The URI of the policy JSON.

params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation the proxy is now forwarding calls to.

params._owner: The new value for the `owner` storage variable.

proxiableUUID().details: IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the if statement.

params._courtID: The ID of the specified court.
params._courtName: The name of the specified court.
params._policy: The URI of the policy JSON.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Reverts if the execution is not performed via delegatecall or the execution context is not of a proxy with an ERC1967-compliant implementation pointing to self.

params.data: Data used in a delegate call to `newImplementation` if non-empty. This will typically be an encoded function call, and allows initializing the storage of the proxy like a Solidity constructor.
params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation contract.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().notice: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).notice: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

PolicyUpdate(uint256,string,string).notice: Emitted when a policy is updated.

Upgraded(address).notice: Emitted when the `implementation` has been successfully upgraded.

proxiableUUID().notice: Implementation of the ERC1822 `proxiableUUID` function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade.

setPolicy(uint256,string,string).notice: Sets the policy for the specified court.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).notice: Upgrade mechanism including access control and UUPS-compliance.

version().notice: Returns the version of the implementation.

userdoc.notice: A contract to maintain a policy for each court.
